Radio telescopes require large diameter dishes because of how resolution works

An interferometer is one way to solve this problem, wherein `telescope[]` acts like one telescope because they are connected to each other
Doing so is called interferometry

$LCP_{Interferometer} = nA = n\pi r^2$

$baseline = B = \Delta_{telescopes}$, the distance between the two farthest apart telescopes

$resolution = R = \frac{\lambda}{B}$
